boardgame.name: vApe Escape
boardgame.description:
vApe Escape is a point-and-click adventure in a science fiction comedy setting. The player takes control of an innocent ape who must escape the sad destiny of becoming a vape dispenser machine for the wealthy hipsters of the universe. The game will take the player across many (read: two) locations on board a space-faring cargo ship transporting vApe dispensers to the galaxy, and features multiple (read: two) endings to the story, depending on how you play it. Since it is imagined as an "interactive comic", you can print out your gameplay in comic-book format once you've finished the game, and put it on your comic-book shelf to impress your friends!

Source: The Game Website.

After an apocalyptic event, the world is divided between the hollowed-out cities controlled by corporations-turned-governments, and tiny villages connected by underground courier tunnels. boardgame.name: For Academic Purposes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Delve into the ruined library of a lost city in search of ancient texts. A quiet, atmospheric stroll through the halls of learning escalates into a race against fire, time, rival delvers, and the security systems of old that are still very much functional...

Introduction

History is written by the victor. But sometimes rewriting history yourself is the best way to get ahead. As feuds over feudal titles and trade privileges escalate, several people in positions of power are interested in firmly establishing their long-standing rights to whatever they have set their eye on. Unfortunately, contradictory historical accounts have landed everyone in a deadlock, and most sources older than that are buried in the now-ruined archives in the haunted capital of a fallen empire.

The superstition surrounding the place is enough to scare off even the most rapacious of noble glory hounds, but that is nothing a band of seasoned adventurers cannot handle.

FOR ACADEMIC PURPOSES is an adventure for a party of 10th-level characters, intended for 4-8 hours of play.

In the year 2047, Artificial Intelligence becomes so powerful that the government uses the technology to control the citizen. Sadly nobody knows about it because A.I. is so smart that it can be invisible to all. A group of radicals called Neuropunk has the latest technology that outperforms A.I. by using their own brain. The goal is to defeat as many A.I. and obtain Achievement Points.

boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

FLOTSAM: ADRIFT AMONGST THE STARS is a roleplaying game about outcasts, renegades and misfits living in the belly of a space station, in the shadow of a more prosperous society. You play through their everyday lives, interpersonal relationships and small-scale drama in the Below, a dangerous world where poverty, social strife and gang conflict sit side-by-side with alien technology and supernatural weirdness.

The game is GMless and diceless, with rules that point your characters at each other and bring their relationships into sharp focus. They help you quickly create a rich setting, flawed characters, and charged relationships which develop over time. You’ll watch your characters evolve and change before your eyes.

The book includes everything you need to play, plus six varied and evocative quick-start scenarios and a teaching guide to help guide your group through the rules.

boardgame.name: Necronomicon: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Necronomicon is a card game set in the dark worlds of H.P. Lovecraft where two players fight each other casting spells, summoning Mythos creatures and using firearms. The knowledge about the mythos can be learnt reading rare arcane books and the magical power can be increased to cast more powerful spells, but also the sanity of the character played will lose sanity progressively, leading to schizofrenia, agorafobia and other terrible effects.

Gameplay:

The objective of the game is to make the life points of the opponent reach zero. From the deck, 5 cards are dealt to each of the players and one card from the hand can be played each round.

There are three ways damage can be inflicted, by using conventional fire arms, casting spells and summoning Mythos creatures. Creatures do not block direct attacks from the cards and they don’t attack directly, instead they counterattack after your opponent has damaged you.

Cards involving the Chtuhu Mythos (spells and creatures) have a sanity cost which is listed as a number in the card.

Apart from the life points, there are four other parameters with a value that will change along the game: i) Elder sign, ii) Arcane power, iii) Taint of the yellow sign, and iv) Sanity.

i) Elder Sign is one defense against the Mythos effects. It can be increased through the use of certain cards. For each point you have, you will take 1 less damage from spell cards and monsters.

ii) Arcane Power represents the magical power gained by the knowledge of the Mythos. Arcane Power can be increased through the use of certain cards such as reading Arcane books. For every point you have, you will deal one extra damage for all cards that show the symbol next to the damage number.

iii) Taint of the yellow sign is a magical curse that can be inflicted using certain cards. Its effect is that for every tainted point you have, you will take one damage at the end of your turn. The only way to purge yourself of the taint is to use certain cards.

iv) Sanity: cards related to the Mythos cost sanity points to use. Sanity is the cost for delving into de Mythos and some cards cost zero due them not being of an occult nature. If your sanity reaches zero you will be insane. There are various types of insanity effects, and one of them will be applied randomly:

Schizophrenia: At the end of each turn, Elder Sign and Arcane Power go to zero.
Megalomania: At the end of each turn, add +2 Arcane and + 4 Taint.
Xenophobia: your summon cards have no effect.
Agoraphobia: you can only have 2 cards in your hand. Remove randomly any excess cards from your hand.

boardgame.name: The Uncharted Swamp
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:
One of the hallmarks of old-school-style role-playing games is a preference for player-driven rather than referee-dominated plots. The reasons for this opposition are that role-playing requires active player participants and an honest game cannot have a foregone conclusion. But creating a true sandbox in which the players characters are free to explore in any direction, their actions seemingly limited only by those actions’ consequences, can be really dang hard.

For instance, let’s say there’s a path that leads from a village to a dungeon. Or several paths. Each path is dark, twisty, and overgrown— and has its own set of preplanned challenges. The players have chosen to travel from the village to the dungeon. But they don’t want to use any of the paths. They don’t even want to creep along in the undergrowth while staying near the
path. They want to traipse through miles of uncharted wilderness and approach the dungeon from the opposite side.

Good for them—they outsmarted the enemy. But they’ve also outsmarted you. (If you’re
thinking, “my players love it when I just wing it!” stop reading now, this product is not for you.)

This adventure aims to solve the problem of dealing with random overland movement through a swamp by offering the referee a really really good random encounter table that doesn’t feel random, but instead hangs together in a meaningful way. In addition to true "wanderers," it also describes a few lairs whose location is not pre-determined, but fixed in the course of play.

This adventure is "pay what you want" because it's an unproven concept delivered by an untested designer. Go ahead, take a look. If you love it as much as I hope you will, you can pay me later or, better yet, tell your friends.

Best for levels 1 - 5.

boardgame.name: Plug the Gap (Fan Expansion for MBT Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
NOTE: This game is no longer for sale

***All briefings and maps can be downloaded from the files section of this page for free. The maps should be printed on 12 x 18 inch paper to produce an 11 x 17 inch map.***

Mind the Gap depicts a never fought 1979/80 engagement in the Fulda Gap using Jim Day's and GMT’s MBT Game pitting an M60A3 Tank Company from the 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment “The Black Horse” against a reinforced Motorized Rifle Battalion equipped with BMP-2 and T-64BV Tanks acting as a Regimental Advance Guard which has penetrated the Regiment's screen line while the rest of the Corps moves into position.

The scenario reflects my experience as a Platoon Leader in the gap as a tank and armored cavalry platoon leader and troop XO in the 1st Squadron, 11th ACR stationed in Fulda from January 1977 – December 1979. The game is not balanced although players may balance it as they deem fit. The actual fight was not; we had a healthy respect for the quantity, if not the quality, of the enemy.

The objective for the Soviet Player is to move 51%+ off the map's West Edge while the US player attempts to destroy the enemy advance guard and restore the screen line.

To play the game, you must have a copy of the initial GMT MBT Game. The expansion includes 9 11 x 17 maps scaled at 100 meters per hex (the same scale as the MBT game), a Scenario Briefing, a B Troop Battle Book and a Soviet Battle book with deployment instructions and order of battle listing, and a small errata sheet. The map is based on a period map of the battle area and utilizes contours to depict elevation.

The map will be mailed to customers and the files may be downloaded from this site.

Expansion sets are not required (BAOR, FRG, and the forthcoming Canadian supplement) provide additional vehicle counters as well as leaders. A list of substitute counters is provided to enable the player to field the complete order of battle for both sides or the players can use some of the expansion set vehicles or combine sets to complete the order of battle.

Mind the Gap can be played with two players but may be more interesting if played with up to 6 players on the US side (CO and the five platoon leaders), and 6 on the USSR side (Battalion Commander and 4 company commanders), and a referee.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Surviv.io
boardgame.description:
The goal of surviv.io is to be the last player standing. You only live once per game - there is no respawn!

2D PUBG
If you've played other battle royale games like PUBG, Fortnite or H1Z1, then you're already halfway there! Think of surviv.io as 2D PUBG (with slightly less desync and more chicken).

Loot and Kill
You'll begin the game with no items other than a simple backpack. Move around the map to find loot: weapons, ammo, scopes, and medical items. Eliminate other players and you can take their loot!

Red = Bad!
Players aren't the only thing that can hurt you. The deadly red zone will move in from the sides of the map and deal increasingly greater damage if you stand in it. Keep an eye on the map and stay safe.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Royale
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Royale is an entry level strategy board game that mimics retro handheld console gameplay (and box/board design). Players begin with a certain number of lives based on their level w/in the game. When they are killed by other players, they re-spawn back at the beginning as if in a video game. Players have weapons that allow them to attack others on the board at certain positions but must move strategically as the other players reveal their moves all at the same time. The purpose of the game is to escape with the elixir of life while accomplishing missions and capturing as many artifacts and gaining as many kill points as possible.

Story: The King is dying and has commissioned 2-4 heroes to capture the stone of life in a nearby dungeon from its Dragon guardian. Only each of the other heroes is battling for their own glory and will not be afraid to kill you in order to capture the stone and other valuable artifacts for themselves. Your goal is to either capture the stone yourself, or complete other missions and gather other valuable artifacts to bring back home.

—description from the publisher

Eyyo,
Got these as part of a Kickstarter that was active in 2019. A multilayer board game, similar style to the Legend of Zelda videogames. Everything here's still sealed and untouched, besides the minis for the photo. The games are all sealed and fresh though.
Dungeon Royale grey box variant, Dungeon Royale dark blue box variant, single player expansion set and three minifigures (damaged, some came this way during the first wave).
"Dungeon Royale is an entry level strategy board game that mimics retro handheld console gameplay (and box/board design). Players begin with a certain number of lives based on their level w/in the game. When they are killed by other players, they re-spawn back at the beginning as if in a video game. Players have weapons that allow them to attack others on the board at certain positions but must move strategically as the other players reveal their moves all at the same time. The purpose of the game is to escape with the elixir of life while accomplishing missions and capturing as many artifacts and gaining as many kill points as possible.
The King is dying and has commissioned 2-4 heroes to capture the stone of life in a nearby dungeon from its Dragon guardian. Only each of the other heroes is battling for their own glory and will not be afraid to kill you in order to capture the stone and other valuable artifacts for themselves. Your goal is to either capture the stone yourself, or complete other missions and gather other valuable artifacts to bring back home.
IT'S LIKE A VIDEO GAME. BUT IT'S NOT. This is an all-out Battle Royale to see who will win the victor's spoils and exit with the Stone of Life. And you can tell your mom it's not a video game...
But it kinda is:
You move through the dungeon at the same time, you attack each other with magical, powerful, or crude weapons. You try to level up before your opponents and you even DIE and then RESPAWN like a video game. You will steal artifacts and treasures from each other, and of course, at times, you'll run away from the destructive dragon."
Cheers for looking, any questions feel free to ask and have a great one.

This includes a numbered version of the Exclusive Grey Box with solo/co-op expansion, and super rare minis.

boardgame.name: Prelude to Biopunk: Gang Ratta
boardgame.description:
Take on the faction of Terra Corporate Security or The Gang Ratta in an all out fight for the sprawl. Will you command the genetically engineered rat-folk or lead the corporate assault on rodent-crime within their borders?

This is a Quantum System product including multiple modular boards, square and counters fighting/movement, ability card play, an easy-intro format and mecha/netrunning content. This game is compatible with other Biopunk products.

Straight up competitive play rules and a mission book are included. Not only fighting is needed to win this module but skill in shady deals, technology and vehicles as well will help you win this running battle between a free people and Corporate enforcement.

More in depth:

This game campaign starts as a fight on a modular square space sprawl board where players compete to become a Boss of the Engineered Rat Lands. In this fight the Ratta gangs will throw weapons, ability cards, and netrunning at each-other to be the last gang standing. Fighting outcome is determined by a mix of die-rolling and ability cards. Movement and fighting also uses action points.

As the missions progress players may find themselves taking the role of Terran Corporate Law Enforcement sworn to end the rodent menace; facing off against the Boss. Missions also include other goal types like advanced computer hacking known as netrunning, shady or above-board diplomacy, vehicles and other mission types.

The winner at the end is determined by that final mission in the campaign book. It may be a last stand by the Ratta or their rise to solvency.

This is a Basic game that not only involves the original struggle in the Biopunk Era in the Infantry HMU but is also appropriate for adult gamers new to tactical board-games.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cookie Chaos
boardgame.description:
It seems way to simple at first ...but after a game or two, it becomes apparent that theres a sophisticated strategy based on an aweseome food group - COOKIES!!

Cookie Chaos is a Euro-style tile laying game. Beginning with the start tile, players choose a tile and add to the "wild start" tile. Match 1 cookie, then collect 1 cookie. Match 2, then collect 2, match 3 then collect 3. There are symbols on the tiles that active actions when you match a cookie, such as: crumble - to send another players cookies back to the tray. Burn - to send everyone's cookies back to the tray. Rolling Pin - to steal another players cookies. Cookies can be protected by using your oven mitt. Players earn their oven mitt by collecting one of each cookie variety. Once earned, place on a single stack/variety to protect them. However, the stack is frozen as well, you cannot collect that variety! Oven mitts can be moved following the game rules, and other players mitts can be moved by drawing a tile with an oven mitt symbol and matching at least one cookie.

It's an ever changing scramble of matching, collecting, stealing and protecting.

The game ends once the last tile has been drawn, played and scored.

The player with the most cookies wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Thief!: Dragon's Treasure
boardgame.description:
You greedy Dwarves! You have all stumbled upon a sleeping dragon with a stash of coins beneath it. Your greed far outweighs your terror as you realise it’s every Dwarf for themselves. You all want a cut of the Dragon’s treasure, but you know that the more coins you steal, the closer you get from waking the terrible fire breathing Dwarf eating red MONSTER!

Do you stay and risk waking the Dragon, or run with your stolen loot in hopes of emerging the den with the most loot.

Thief! Dragon's Treasure is a light blind bag pull and pass game by designer, Albert Caynes. The game was originally designed at the request of an Australian publisher, however, the co-owner of the publisher had not confirmed with the other publisher, leading to a complete re-theme of the game.

The game is all about Dwarves stealing coins from a sleeping dragon, keep pushing your luck and stealing coins until you run, or you're eaten!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fortune Fame & Glory
boardgame.description:
Fortune Fame & Glory
These are dark times, where goblin-kind roam the forest, giants steal livestock, and barbarians raid villages. There are whispers in the night of hidden treasure, a magical artifact, and the return of the Dark One. Like your ancestors, it’s in your blood to be a hero of renown. Heroes need a quest, and so you set out on an adventure for fortune, fame, and glory.

Fortune Fame & Glory is a "low ink" free print and play fantasy card and dice game of adventure, combat, and treasure.
Start by removing the three "end game" cards. Then shuffle the deck and lay the cards face down in ten columns. Set your health, attack bonus, gold, food units, and fate on the character card. Gameplay begins by turning over the first far left card. Read the card's scenario and follow its instructions, before moving to the next card. Cards contain encounters such as monster combat, weapon and health upgrades, penalties, and more. After making your way to the far right, reshuffle the cards and lay them out again. Start again at the far left card and make your way to the right. Repeat this sequence three times before facing one of the end game boss cards. Defeating one of the three boss cards gives you either fortune, fame or glory.

The final goal of the game is to survive 3-9 rounds. After each successful third round of cards, you face one of the end game bosses in hopes of acquiring fortune, fame, and glory.
—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Taktillinen partiopeli
boardgame.description:
Simple tactical wargame of two identical forces of contemporary military units on cardboard standees trying to capture the other side's headquarters (flag piece). Played on a map where pieces can only move along roads and foot paths shown in three different colors that allow units to move one to three steps per turn. Combat is deterministic with either the attacked piece being eliminated or both pieces depending on the types of pieces involved. Barbed wire can be used to block enemy movement. Each side's forces includes two demolition units that can destroy any enemy piece (including barbed wire) at the cost of itself also being destroyed. They can also be used to demolish any of the five bridges shown on the map and red wooden pawns are included in the game to mark bridges that have been destroyed.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Keepers of Tradition 1
boardgame.description:
The firm hand rules all

The Camarilla is an exclusive organization of vampires that speaks for and legislates its members all over the world (at least, in theory). Bound by a number of Traditions detailing the creation, behavior and destruction of Kindred, the sect also strives to hide to existence of all vampire activity from mortal eyes. This deception, called the Masquerade, is at the core of the Camarilla’s existence; the struggle to universally uphold the Masquerade is what drives much of the sect’s policy and direction.

This set is a fixed assortment of 120 cards for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – 33 library cards and 87 crypt cards of clans Brujah, Gangrel, Malkavian and Nosferatu. All were first created for the original Keepers of Tradition expansion 2008, since long out of print and in great demand among players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Operation Last Train
boardgame.description:
In the far future, humans have spread across the galaxy. Gigantic ships ply the stars - stars that lie under the shadow of a terrible swarm. The militaries of humanity are joined in an impossibly huge fleet to dam the bugs’ advance, but many planets have already fallen. While the bulk of the fleets weighs anchor for refit, a fast cutter is dispatched to Helos - one such ruined world - with a complement of one hundred volunteers. They have ninety days to rescue as many stranded survivors as they can.

Operation Last Train is a solo or cooperative game designed to use sci-fi soldiers from any range in any combination. Teams of six volunteers drop in mixed units to rescue civilians. They are opposed by a never-ending tide of ravening bugs. Fast combat and a simple AI make for quick and exciting games that fit on a kitchen table. Track the status and experience of each volunteer and rotate rosters to meet the needs of the day. This is a game of emergent narrative. It’s easy to make the world personal and engaging. The volunteers may come from every company and regiment the future could hold. No two drops need look or play the same.

Each turn, a volunteer may take a move action and a shoot action (any melee combat is resolved as part of the move action that brings volunteers and bugs into contact). Combat is resolved with ten-sided dice. The bugs have no ranged capabilities - in any shoot action, the bugs are either missed, knocked down, or killed depending on the roll. In melee, the volunteers' roll decides everything: a volunteer's failure is her enemy's success. A volunteer's load-out and regiment determine how many dice she rolls, and what qualifies as a hit. After the volunteers have performed all of their actions, a simple AI governs the movement of any bugs on the table.

Scenarios lay out the specifics of the volunteers' objectives. The game ends when those objectives are met, or all volunteers are off of the table. Generally, objectives revolve around searching for, and escorting survivors off the table.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Libertine Ball
boardgame.description:
Toreador of the Sabbat sect strive for perfection in art and pleasure, but they lack all notions of self-restraint. Their road to enlightment is paved with pain and perversion. Their tools are mortals, more or less willing, and the more tools the merrier at the Libertine Ball.

The Toreador antitribu are legendary for their dazzling charm. Your strategy with this deck is strength in numbers: you aim to influence as many young minions as possible to overwhelm your enemies and secure victory.

This is a deck with 77 library cards and 12 crypt cards, ready for play out of the box or customizable with other Vampire: The Eternal Struggle cards. Each player needs a deck to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Richesses d'Armor
boardgame.description:
Richesses d'Armor is a local game made by women farmers.

The goal of the game is to create a farm by reconstructing a puzzle of six pieces. Each piece represents the various components of the farm: production, status of the farmer, building, equipment, crops and diversification activities (tourism, sale of farm products ...). From dairy farming to pig farming, including beef, poultry, mutton and vegetables, six farms, representative of all the productions present in Côtes-d'Armor, must be reconstituted. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a sum in euros to buy the pieces of the puzzle. During his journey in the department, the player answers questions about agriculture, economy, heritage ... What is the particularity of a biennial plant? According to the legend, who is at the origin of the source of the Rance ? .... In total more than 600 questions classified according to three major themes. The correct answers and event cards allow to buy the pieces of the puzzle. The player loses money with certain cards or when he passes on the exploitation of another player.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Der Apfelwurm von Alriksfurt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Every year the Alriksfurter celebrate their big apple festival in honour of the local saint Nadiana of Norburg. Together they bake the Great Apple Pie from the apples of the holy apple basket of Nadiana - a speciality that is also known beyond the borders of Alrikfurt.
But this year will be different. The holy apple basket was stolen from the Perainekapelle and the thief caused chaos and destruction inside the goddess house. On behalf of the village school the adventurers declare themselves ready to clarify the whereabouts of the missing apple basket.
The heroes encounter unexpected problems during their search in the Reichsforst. The thief probably made use of supernatural means to steal the basket and the dark power responsible for it does everything to stop the hero group. They do not shy away from anything. Will the heroes succeed in defeating their enemies and returning Nadiana's apple basket safely to Alriksfurt in the end? Or do the villains manage to carry out their sinister plan?

Keywords to the adventure: a disappeared holy apple basket, a thieving pest worm and an evil tree including charcoal burners.
Genre: Wilderness Adventure
Prerequisites: helpfulness
Location: Alriksfurt, Garetien
Time: from 1040 BF
complexity (player/master): low / low
Heroes' experience: average to experienced
Requirements:
Wilderness 2/4
Fight 2/4
Social interaction 1/4
Living history 1/4


Klappentext

Jedes Jahr feiern die Alriksfurter ihr großes Apfelfest zu Ehren der Lokalheiligen Nadiana von Norburg. Zusammen backt man den Großen Apfelkuchen aus den Äpfeln des heiligen Apfelkorbs von Nadiana – eine Spezialität, die auch jenseits der Grenzen Alrikfurts bekannt ist.
Doch dieses Jahr kommt es anders. Der heilige Apfelkorb wurde aus der Perainekapelle entwendet und der Dieb hat im Inneren des Göttinnenhauses Chaos und Zerstörung angerichtet. Im Auftrag des Dorfschulzen erklären sich die Abenteurer bereit, den Verbleib des vermissten Apfelkorbes aufzuklären.
Die Helden stoßen bei ihrer Suche im Reichsforst auf ungeahnte Probleme. Der Dieb bediente sich wohl übernatürlicher Möglichkeiten, um den Korb zu stehlen und die finstere Macht, die dafür verantwortlich ist, setzt alles daran, um die Heldengruppe aufzuhalten. Dabei schreckt sie vor nichts zurück. Wird es den Helden am Ende gelingen, ihre Gegner zu besiegen und Nadianas Apfelkorb wieder sicher nach Alriksfurt zurückzubringen? Oder gelingt es den Schurken, ihren finsteren Plan durchzuführen?
Stichworte zum Abenteuer: ein verschwundener heiliger Apfelkorb, ein diebischer Tatzelwurm und ein böser Baum samt Köhlerkultisten
Genre: Wildnisabenteuer
Voraussetzungen: Hilfsbereitschaft
Ort: Alriksfurt, Garetien
Zeit: ab 1040 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): niedrig / niedrig
Erfahrung der Helden: durchschnittlich bis erfahren
Anforderungen:
Wildniskunde 2/4
Kampf 2/4
Soziale Interaktion 1/4
Lebendige Geschichte 1/4

boardgame.name: Een feest voor de ogen
Ein Fest fr die Augen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The evening waves gently hit the green shore of the Zorgan Flamingo Lake, where the sparkling lights of the Typographic Institute are reflected. It is precisely there that the Mada Basari has commissioned traces of black marketing to be traced, when the writer Emiramis also meets an unforeseen accident at the Förderfest. Righteous and attentive heroes are needed to assemble the individual mosaic pieces and unravel the mesh. In the middle of the impressive Sulaminiah and the narrow streets of Zorrigan, shabby smugglers and thieves hide other obscure figures. What dark secret is to be uncovered here? Will the heroes see through the beautiful appearance and will be able to see behind
the façade?
Keywords to the adventure: Participation and clarification of a murder, search for traces in Zorgan, discreet penetration into a town house, Belkelel cultists including Bhurkhesch

Genre: Detective and Company Adventure
Prerequisites: Helpful heroes with an interest in intrigue and secrecy
Place: Zorgan, Mhaharanyat Aranien
Time: from 1041 BF
Complexity (player/master): low / medium
Heroes' experience: average to competent

Requirements:
Social talents 2/4
Body talents 3/4
Fight 1/4
Living history 1/4


Klappentext

Sanft treffen die abendlichen Wellen auf das grüne Ufer des Zorganer Flamingo-Sees, in dem sich die funkelnden Lichter des Typographischen Instituts spiegeln. Gerade dort heißt es im Auftrag der Mada Basari Spuren von Schwarzhandel nachzugehen, als auf dem Förderfest auch noch die Schreiberin Emiramis ein unvorhergesehenes Unglück trifft. Rechtschaffene und aufmerksame Helden sind nötig, um die einzelnen Mosaiksteine zusammenzufügen und das Geflecht zu entwirren. Mitten im beeindruckenden Sulaminiah und den engen Gassen Zorrigans verbergen sich neben schäbigen Schmugglern und Dieben auch andere obskure Gestalten. Welches düstere Geheimnis ist hier aufzudecken? Werden die Helden den schönen Schein durchschauen und hinter
die Fassade blicken?
Stichworte zum Abenteuer: Festteilnahme und Aufklärung eines Mordes, Spurensuche in Zorgan, diskretes Eindringen in ein Stadthaus, Belkelel-Kultisten samt Bhurkhesch

Genre: Detektiv- und Gesellschaftsabenteuer
Voraussetzungen: Hilfsbereite Helden mit Interesse an Intrigen und Heimlichkeit
Ort: Zorgan, Mhaharanyat Aranien
Zeit: ab 1041 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): niedrig / mittel
Erfahrung der Helden: durchschnittlich bis kompetent

boardgame.name: Nachtschwarze See
Nachtzwarte Zee
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Whether on the rough coasts of the Tobric Sea, the sunny beaches of the Pearl Sea or the jagged cliffs of the Sea of Seven Winds, people everywhere have at least once in their lives looked out at the sea and directed their thoughts towards the horizon. The sea. It promises boundless freedom and awakens unknown desires. A place of hopes and dreams, where courageous traders smell good business and daredevil pirates crave rich prey. Phex will reward those who know how to circumnavigate all the shallows along their way.

But at the mercy of Efferd's whims, many a voyage can become an ordeal that will require the brave men and women on board to at least survive. This will also be felt by the heroes, who will be the solid
the ground of the mainland against the swaying planks of a merchant ship. Only through the strength of the community will they be able to withstand the many dangers that put their cohesion to the test. And who knows what horrors lurk in the depths?

Tags on adventure: a voyage on the open sea, numerous dangers of natural and supernatural origin, a decision of conscience.

Genre: Travel Adventure
Prerequisites: Heroes who are ready to board a ship
Location: on the high seas
Time: from 1040 BF
Complexity (player/master): low to medium / high
Heroes' experience: average to competent
Requirements:
Combat Talents 3/4
Social talents 2/4
Skilled craftsmen 1/4
Living history 1/4



KlappentextOb an den rauen Küsten der Tobrischen See, den sonnigen Stränden des Perlenmeers oder den zerklüfteten Klippen des Meers der Sieben Winde, überall haben die Menschen wenigstens einmal im Leben hinaus aufs Meer geblickt und ihre Gedanken Richtung Horizont gelenkt. Die See. Sie verspricht grenzenlose Freiheit und weckt unbekannte Sehnsüchte. Ein Ort der Hoffnungen und Träume, wo mutige Händler gute Geschäfte wittern und tollkühne Piraten nach reicher Beute gieren. Phex wird diejenigen belohnen, die es verstehen, alle Untiefen entlang ihres Weges zu umschiffen.

Doch Efferds Launen ausgeliefert kann so manche Seefahrt zu einer Tortur werden, die den tapferen Männern und Frauen an Bord alles abverlangen wird, um zumindest mit dem Leben davon zu kommen. Das werden auch die Helden zu spüren bekommen, die den soliden
Boden des Festlands gegen die schwankenden Planken eines Handelsschiffes getauscht haben. Nur durch die Stärke der Gemeinschaft werden sie den zahlreichen Gefahren trotzen können, bei denen ihr Zusammenhalt auf eine harte Probe gestellt wird. Und wer weiß schon, welche Schrecken noch in der Tiefe lauern?

boardgame.name: Heldenwerk Archiv 2
Heldenwerk Archiv II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Hero's Work Archive 2 unites seven fantastic short adventures that offer challenges to your heroes throughout Aventuria. All adventures have been commented by the respective authors for this collective edition and supplemented with additional game material. Six of the seven adventures come from the Heldenwerk series, the seventh appeared as a special edition of Kaiser-Raul-Konvent and RatCon 2018.

In Deicherbe, the heroes on the stormy coast of Nostria help a dike farmer and not only save his farm, but also solve secrets from ancient times.

The beet harvest is particularly lavish for a small native village. But if the joy is disturbed by ghostly phenomena and at the latest when a plague of rats breaks out, it seems certain that this harvest is cursed.

Slaves for one night leads the heroes in slave chains to Al'Anfa and into the possession of intriguing grandes. To regain their freedom and take revenge, they must skillfully navigate the intrigues of a Granden house and the moods of its owners.

Revenge is Stockfisch is an adventure for justice and justice in Thorwal, the heroes help a girl find her mother's murderer and escape unjust punishment.

There is also a murder to be solved in Bloody Wine. This time at the edge of an Almadan wine festival and the old feud of two winegrower families, who are the only ones who have the secret of a special wine variety.

The Paligan files are full of explosive information that could cause great damage to the Middle Kingdom. On behalf of the empire, the heroes try to take the files in Perricum, but several cunning competitors try to beat them.

Three colours of snow lead the heroes to winterly Sewerien, the remote north of Borland, where Bronnjars are the undisputed masters of their land and where snow hides not only the landscape but also ancient sins and dark secrets.

Seven TDE group adventures for 3-5 heroes

Genre: Adventure Story

Requirements: depending on adventure

Location: Al2019Anfa, Almada, Borland, Nostria, Rommilys, Thorwal

Time: depending on adventure, from 1035 BF to 1040 BF or later

Complexity
(Player/Master): low - high / low - high

Experience of the heroes: inexperienced to masterly

Important skills:
Company 3
Fight 2
Body 2
Living History 2


Klappentext

Das Heldenwerk-Archiv 2 vereint sieben phantastische Kurzabenteuer, die deinen Helden Herausforderungen in ganz Aventurien bieten. Alle Abenteuer wurden für diese Sammelausgabe von den jeweiligen Autoren kommentiert und mit zusätzlichem Spielmaterial ergänzt. Sechs der sieben Abenteuer entstammen der Heldenwerk-Reihe, das siebte erschien als Sonderausgabe zu Kaiser-Raul-Konvent und RatCon 2018.

In Deicherbe stehen die Helden an der stürmischen Küste Nostrias einem Deichbauern bei und retten nicht nur seinen Hof, sondern lösen auch Geheimnisse aus alten Zeiten.

Die Rübenernte fällt einem kleinen bornischen Dorf besonders üppig aus. Doch wird die Freude von Geistererscheinungen gestört und spätestens als eine Rattenplage ausbricht, scheint es sicher, dass diese Ernte verflucht ist.

Sklaven für eine Nacht führt die Helden in Sklavenketten nach Al'Anfa und in den Besitz intriganter Granden. Um ihre Freiheit wiederzuerlangen und Rache nehmen zu können, müssen sie geschickt die Intrigen eines Grandenhauses und die Launen ihrer Besitzer navigieren.

Rache ist Stockfisch ist ein Abenteuer um Recht und Gerechtigkeit in Thorwal, die Helden stehen einem Mädchen bei, den Mörder ihrer Mutter zu finden und einer ungerechten Strafe zu entgehen.

Auch in Blutiger Wein gibt es einen Mord aufzuklären. Diesmal am Rande eines almadanischen Weinfestes und der alten Fehde zweier Winzerfamilien, die als einzige über das Geheimnis einer speziellen Weinsorte verfügen.

Die Paligan-Akten sind voll von brisanten Informationen, die dem Mittelreich großen Schaden zufügen könnten. Im Auftrag des Reiches versuchen die Helden die Akten in Perricum an sich zu bringen, doch mehrere gerissene Konkurrenten versuchen ihnen zuvor zu kommen.

Drei Farben Schnee führt die Helden ins winterliche Sewerien, den abgelegenen Norden des Bornlands, wo Bronnjaren die unumstrittenen Herren ihres Landes sind und der Schnee nicht nur die Landschaft, sondern auch alte Sünden und dunkle Geheimnisse verbirgt.

Sieben DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3-5 Helden

Genre: Abenteuergeschichte

Voraussetzungen: je nach Abenteuer

Ort: Al'Anfa, Almada, das Bornland, Nostria, Rommilys, Thorwal

Zeit: je nach Abenteuer, ab 1035 BF bis 1040 BF oder später

Komplexität
(Spieler/Meister): gering - hoch / gering - hoch

Erfahrung der Helden: unerfahren bis meisterlich

Gesellschaft 3
Kampf 2
Körper 2
Lebendige Geschichte 2

boardgame.name: Silvana's bevrijding
Silvanas Befreiung
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Havena. The legendary port city on the Sea of Seven Winds was the beginning of an adventurous life for many. With its flourishing trade and almost unlimited possibilities, however, the capital of Albernia attracts not only courageous heroes, but also all sorts of knights of fortune who are looking for quick wealth. Many of them sooner or later end up in the dirty Orkendorf, a neglected haven for outlaws and those who want to become outlaws. But all these worldly problems disappear into the distance when you sit in the tavern Schipperkrug with a cool glass of beer and listen to the stories of the seafarers...

... there is not this elderly lady who desperately approaches the heroes and asks them to free her abducted granddaughter Silvana from the clutches of unscrupulous criminals. Because when a defenceless young woman is the victim of a kidnapping, the city guard fears for her life during investigations in the orc village and nobody else can help: Then true heroes are in demand who want to dare Silvana's liberation!


Klappentext

Havena. Die sagenumwobene Hafenstadt am Meer der Sieben Winde war schon für so Manchen der Beginn eines Lebens als Abenteurer. Mit seinem florierenden Handel und den nahezu unbegrenzten Möglichkeiten zieht die Hauptstadt Albernias jedoch nicht nur mutige Helden an, sondern auch allerlei Glücksritter, die den schnellen Reichtum suchen. Viele von ihnen landen früher oder später im dreckigen Stadtteil Orkendorf, einem verwahrlosten Unterschlupf für Gesetzlose und jene, die es werden wollen. Doch all diese weltlichen Probleme rücken in die Ferne, wenn man bei einem kühlen Humpen Bier in der Taverne Schipperkrug sitzt und den Geschichten der Seefahrer lauscht…

… wäre da nicht diese ältere Dame, die verzweifelt auf die Helden zukommt und sie bittet, ihre entführte Enkelin Silvana aus den Fängen von skrupellosen Verbrechern zu befreien. Denn wenn eine schutzlose, junge Frau Opfer einer Entführung wurde, die Stadtwache bei Ermittlungen im Orkendorf um ihr Leben fürchtet und niemand sonst helfen kann: Dann sind wahre Helden gefragt, die Silvanas Befreiung wagen wollen!

boardgame.name: akronym
akrnym
boardgame.description:
The hilarious party game of made up acronyms that will have you LOL with your BFFs!

Over six rounds collect points ( and try not to lose any). While thinking of the funniest acronyms from the letters and subject.

One person draws three cards each with a letter on it, then they draw a category card. Flip the timer and go, think up the best acronyms that fit the category and the three letters. Once time runs out take turns reading what you feel is your best answer. Each person votes who they think gave the best acronym and every vote counts as a point.

During speed rounds, who ever is in the lead starts. They must think of the first acronym on the fly and say it outloud then play passes to the next player. When the timer stops, that player loses two points. After six rounds tally up the points, and the most wins!

boardgame.name: Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands is a tabletop roleplaying game about politics, adventure and discovery in a geomantic fantasy world based on Tabula Game's Mysthea Universe.

Legends From the Borderlands takes place on a backdrop of war. A few hundred years ago, the floating continent of Mysthea was home to dozens of independent city-states, with the world-shattering cataclysm an ancient memory. Now, only two major powers remain: the Kingdom of Ahatils and the Kitrean Empire. The Kingdom is aggressively expansionist, lead by a conqueror-king whose boredom with governance lead to him delegating rule of his conquered lands to the ancient Guilds of Ilvash. The Empire is more insidious, letting its territories rule themselves freely only as long as they cast aside their old customs and religions and follow the Empire's doctrine. And between these two monoliths lie the borderlands - a narrow strip of territory whose cities are treated as pawns in the game of empires.

Now a great war has been sparked into flame, and its battles shake the continent. As the war front moves ever closer to Kitrean heartlands, the Ilvashan Guilds send a convoy to control, reinforce and rebuild the newly-liberated of Montara. But as the Guilds meet with local Orders and Cabals, and contend with the perils of the too-close war front, they may find their loyalty to Ilvash and Ahatils tested. Will they stay true to their mission and make this city a vassal of their ancestor guilds, try to secure its independence, or use its resources to gain dominion over the Guilds in the Kingdom's capital?

The game has been renamed during the course of the Kickstarter and was released as "Shattered City"

boardgame.name: The Bitter March
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

AS THE DULKODEL WAR RUMBLES ON, THE GUILDS OF ILVASH SEND THEIR VASSALS TO TAKE OVER A NEWLY-CAPTURED CITY. WHAT DANGERS WILL THEY ENCOUNTER ON THE WAY TO MONTARA? HOW WILL THE CITY GREET THEM - AS CONQUERORS, OR AS LIBERATORS? AND WHAT WILL THE FORCES OF THE EMPIRE DO TO TRY AND RECLAIM IT?

This Quickstart is a sampler for Mysthea Legends of the Borderlands now on Kickstarter!

In UFO Press's adaptation of Legacy to Tabula Games' setting, you’ll lead your own Guilds and Heroes, explore a unique geomantic fantasy world, and rebuild a city over generations.

Each campaign of Mysthea: Legends From the Borderlands starts with your Guilds sent as a joint venture to a city recently devastated by the war between your Kingdom and the Empire. As a group, you’ll decide which regions were ruined by the war, which were claimed by local factions, where your Guild can find solace, and where dangers lurk.

As you play, you’ll rebuild the ruined neighbourhoods, forge uneasy alliances with the Empire’s remnants, and shore up defences against the arcane storms and monsters that ravage the lands. Through grand Guild Wonders and character-driven Quests you’ll change the city, and the city will change you. And once generations have passed as your metropolis is thriving, how will you deal with your parent guilds back home? Will you present the city gift-wrapped for their pleasure? Withdraw and declare your independence? Or use the city’s resources to steal their might and authority for your own?

boardgame.name: PROPAGANDA
boardgame.description:
The purpose of the game is to permanently establish an ideology in the world, so it can flourish and, in time, become the dominant rule. There can be between 2-4 different ideologies competing to rule 12 Regions (plus one passive player too, The Anarchist). You expand your ideology by using Propaganda Cards to convert other people to your rule. The goal is to generate enough income to buy Strongholds. In return you will get Donations from loyal subjects with each passing round, to further promote your ideology. The first player who holds 3 Strongholds for 1 entire round wins the game.

The different ideologies are:

The Dictator (Autocracy)
The Capitalist (Democracy)
The Communist (Totalitarian)
The Fundamentalist (Theocracy)

boardgame.name: Vietnam Quest
ng Hnh
boardgame.description:
Vietnam Quest, also titled ng Hành (in Vietnamese meaning togetherness), is a collaborative game of strategy and teamwork. The game is set in 19th century Vietnam. Players take turns traveling through the country using actions like moving, building and harvesting. Actions have costs, so players must plan carefully. In addition, there are also bandits that randomly appear as the game develops. Players will work together to exchange resources when necessary to move efficiently or fight off bandits. In order to win the game, all areas of the map has to be discovered. In addition to visiting all regions, players can also challenge to clear out all bandits to claim a perfect victory.

Originally designed in Vietnamese, this game has also been translated into English to attract an international audience. The game features a foldable map, resource crystals, region cards and icons, village rings, a rolling die, villagers and bandit cubes. Vietnam Quest also comes with advanced rules for a more challenging game with variants and different winning conditions. The game also includes region cards which shares historic facts and information about the destinations. Players connect and learn many things about Vietnam, from its culture, food, and geography.

—user summary

boardgame.name: 1864: On To Jutland!
boardgame.description:
1864 covers one of the 19th century’s least known conflicts, a brutal struggle for Schleswig and the Jutland peninsula as Denmark attempts to retain her holdings in Germany. The game is a quick playing, no-frills simulation which uses an odds-based Combat Result Table and Artillery Fire Table with a d10 roll to process combat. Headquarters can allow units to stack at greater limits and provide a little fog-of-war. Finally, a what-if option allows for Swedish intervention on the Danish side, as they had prepared around 30,000 volunteers to do so but it never came to fruition. It includes a 22x17" map, 140 counters, and 2 holding-box aids.

WEIGHT: 3/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

boardgame.name: Phone Bomb
boardgame.description:
Phone Bomb is an hybrid game in which you'll have to cooperate to defuse a bomb. This bomb is managed by a mobile application. While you lunch the app, you've got 60 seconds to successfully disarm a bomb.

To do this, all players receive 4 cards. When you get the bomb in front of you, you'll have to play two cards. If you can make a symbol by pairing the good cards, you'll be allowed to do the corresponding action on the bomb.

For example, by playing two cards with a red wire, you'll be allowed to cut a red wire from the bomb. You can also add time, get information on the wires, flee or prepare your interview. After playing two cards, you realise the action on the bomb, you give it to the next player and you take 2 cards.

Last point is, while a player handle the bomb, all other players can exchange their cards. The only restriction is not to show your cards.

To disarm the bomb, you'll have to cut 3 good wire. But there are also 3 trapped wires that make the bomb explode if you cut them all. When you think the operation will be a failure, you better have to flee.

If the game seems cooperative at the first play, it isn't. If the bomb is defused, only the players who stay in the team get 2 points. If the bomb explode, only the ones who flee get 1 point.

In an advanced mode, you get a random objective for the round. So for example, you'll get one point if you cut all the blue wire ... even if the bomb explode.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Slips
boardgame.description:
Slips is a real-time game in which you have to be the quickest player to discard all your cards.

To set up the game, you put four cards on the table and share all the remaining cards to the players. Then, the round can start and all players browse their cards as they want to find cards they can discard.

To discard a card, you have to fill the requirement indicated on the top of the card. This requirement is to find the same colored slips in the middle of the table.

When a player had played all of their cards and is sure they can't play anymore, they shout "fête du slip". The round is stopped. If the player has no more cards or can't play any of their remaining cards, they win the round and score no points. If they're wrong, they score 2 points per card. All other players score 1 point per card.

The aim of the game is to finish with the fewest points possible.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rapid Falls
boardgame.description:
We're in the end of the 70's in Rapid Falls, a small town in South Dakota. An Air Force base, rotten motels and diners, beautiful crates, an Indian reserve and some remains from Western, nothing is missing ... A familiar universe enriched with the great mythologies of the time : ufo, sasquatch and ...

In Rapid Falls, you will follow the adventures of two protagonists who oppose everything: Gwen, a nonviolent empathic medium and Jeffrey, a cynical, grumpy and disillusioned cop. Through their adventures, you will plunge into America of the seventies through their eyes and reactions. The tone is mature, the themes are sometimes a little dark or tragic, and some situations sadly ironic. The relationship between characters evolves over the course of investigations and narrative arcs.

Rapid Falls is a trans-media gaming project with a board, booklets, tokens and some digital game aids (MP3 audio of interrogations or PDF files for easy searching).

How to play? Put the board on the table and discover the city of Rapid Falls. Then, take your case an start your investigation. Browse the booklet to be given clue. Check for the driver's licence database to find people. Get tokens to unlock some informations.

Will you try to go the fastest to the final issue? Or do you prefer to explore this world and maybe find its hidden secrets? It's up to you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Holmes' Horror Hotel
boardgame.description:
The date is May 7, 1896. On this day H.H. Holmes was hanged, for the murder of at least 9 innocent victims, but suspected of much, much more. Or was he?
Perhaps he succeeded in framing an unknowing employee of his famous Horror Hotel? Let's find out!

In Holmes' Horror Hotel players assume the roles of either employees of the hotel, or the owner himself, H.H. Holmes. The roles are secret, so only the player that is dealt the Holmes character knows who is who.
The employees know by now that danger is afoot in the hotel, but they don't know who is behind it all. And on this dark night in 1896, they find all the doors and windows of the hotel locked.
There is no escape, their only chance is to expose the serial killer before they all die a gruesome death…

Players in turn draw 1-3 cards. These cards can be traps, clues or dead ends. Traps hurt you and can eliminate you from the game, clues can be used to identify the killer- or frame an innocent coworker - and dead ends are... dead ends and should be discarded. The employees have to play all their cards truthfully, only Holmes can lie and discard unwanted traps or clues. But when he gets called out on this, it's game over for him. Can the employees survive and identify Holmes as the killer in their midst before time runs out?

Holmes' Horror Hotel is a fast game of deduction and hidden identities, for 4 to 7 players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 0079 Gundam
boardgame.description:
A Point to point board wargame on the One year war focusing exclusively on the original Gundam TV anime show which ran from 1979 to 1980.

2 maps
204 counters
9 pages of rules
2 charts
1 turn= 1 month

For 2 players where one player plays the Earth Federation and the other plays the Zeon Principality. Units are comprise of Mobile suit units, and space fleets. Also represented are important characters to the anime like Amuro Rey, Char Aznable etc. these characters can influence unit combat give modifiers etc.

Two maps represent the Earth and the near space, with important Earth and space regions.

Victory is done via Victory points, the one that has the highest victory points by the end of the game (month 12) or gets to a certain number of VPs before the end of the game wins sudden death. These VPs can be had by destruction of mech units, death of important characters and conquest of important points in the maps.

This game looks to be a simplified version of the TDF game One Year War and is for the Gundam purists who only want to focus on the 1979 to 1980 anime and nothing else.

boardgame.name: Paras
boardgame.description:
Paras is an area control, dexterity game for 2 to 4 players. All the action takes place on a 5x5 square wooden board. Each of the 25 territories is surrounded by a 3mm high border. Each player starts with 24 8mm cubed units. On each turn, you try to expand expand your control by choosing one of three options:


Throw two dice on the board. Depending on where the dice land and what number is rolled, you may get to deploy your units.
Move units on the board.
Attack opponent units in an adjacent territory. (The attack mechanism is inspired by Classic Warlord and implemented with the blessing of Mike Hayes).


In the basic game, the objective is to be the player who has the most territories when the game ends. For advanced play, specific missions can be set up before the start of play.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Command Group Vietnam
boardgame.description:
This games simulates tactical firefights during the Vietnam War. Special attention is paid to the command structure of the fighting troops. Players commanding several platoons (PLT), consisting of a command group (CG) and 3-4 squads (SQ) or 3-4 vehicles.

Players draw chits from a stack to activate a certain platoon formation. The CG of a formation can activate all of their subordinate units, which can perform actions. When all possible actions have been performed, the activation is completed and the next activation chit is drawn.

Through the bidding of command points (CP) it is possible to see the topmost activation chits and eventually change their position in the stack

When all the player’s PLT have been activated, a new turn starts. This goes on until the last round is reached, as indicated by the scenario and the winner can be determined according to the victory conditions.

boardgame.name: The Garrison of Greassnggraus aka All About Adventuring in the Wilderness
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Wilderness adventures - These are the basics of FRPG, right? Even if it isn’t the adventure itself, the player characters still have to get through it to get to the adventures. So why have they been sliding in popularity. Are wilderness adventures completely played out?

Of course not, but some of us GMs need some new inspiration, some new ways to look at the wilderness in order to bring back that sense of exploration. That is exactly what this book is all about! How can we make wilderness settings fun and challenging again? That all sounds great, but we also need to keep in mind that this needs to be doable without swamping the GM with more work than hours in the day.

Whether your first adventure was exploring some monster filled caves from a border keep or not, this is edition is going to bring you back to those glory days when role-playing games were new and exciting. This garrison is also in a border land and serves as a base where GMs and players can kick off their adventuring. But this time, things make sense. An adult can look at the setting and not immediately start pointing out the plot holes. Beware - You’re going to read this and immediately start playing or plotting out your next wilderness quest line.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

This supplement contains 22 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 60 pages.

boardgame.name: Kingslayer
boardgame.description:
A fast-paced and easy to learn competitive wargame for 2-4 players. Players manage an economy of resources and play event cards in order to build and expand an empire and destroy their opponents. There is only one winner in every game of Kingslayer, but there are three paths to victory: slay an opposing king, control 20 territories, or control the most territories when the deck of event cards runs out. Kingslayer, at it's core, is an exercise in resource management.

Players will spend their resources to send their units into unclaimed territories and to build settlements. Each territory may contain one settlement and for every settlement built players can add a resource to the resource pool. Players may use their new resources to continue to move units, build settlements, or attack opposing units. Players may also spend their resources on recruiting new units, which may only be placed on the same territory as their king, which can not move. Combat is decided through dice rolls and favors outnumbering your opponent as well as the attacker.

Kingslayer uses a unique turn order mechanic which moves in a clockwise order, but only for players with at least one resource currently in the resource pool. If a player doesn't have any resources in the resource pool, their turn is skipped. If no resources of any color are in the resource pool, the pool is refreshed and all players draw a card. As long as players have at least one resource in the resource pool, they may play one card on their turn instead of spending resources.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Knitting: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Knitting - The Card Game is oozing with fun knitting terminology, beautiful photos from fiber artists and game mechanics that mirror knit life.

Players start the game with pattern cards and yarn cards. Turn order consists of 1. Knitting (advancing time card) 2. Drawing Yarn Cards from the Yarn Store or Choosing additional Pattern Cards 3. Casting-On (only one pattern per turn) 4. Restock the Yarn Store. *Community Cards cost 5 Yarn Cards and can be bought or spent at any time during a players turn. The Community deck is filled with action cards and secret points.

Pattern cards have both yarn and time requirements. Collect Yarn Cards from the Yarn Store and when you have the right yarn for a pattern, 'Cast-On' by placing the Pattern Card and required Yarn Card(s) on the table along with the Cast-On (time) Card. Each round thereafter advances your project by one week. When the time requirement is met, discard the yarn cards and move the pattern card to the 'Blocking Mat' as a way to keep track of your FO (finished object) points. Each player starts with 4 Cast-On cards and can have up to 4 active projects in-progress at any given time.

No previous knitting knowledge required to play. But if you are a knitter you can play this with your non-knitter friends and family to give them a peek into your fiber-y world or play with other knitters and meta game while knitting on matching patterns irl to earn extra points.

From the back of the book:

WELCOME TO GRIM & PERILOUS GAMING

Winner of the ENnie gold Best Game and Product of the Year at Gen Con 2018, featured on Forbes.com, ranked one of the best-selling fantasy tabletop role-playing games at DriveThruRPG, and having moved over 90,000 copies worldwide, ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG is a bloodier, grimmer, and grittier version of classic tabletop role-playing games. This revised edition is published in celebration with Andrews McMeel Publishing, and features a refreshed layout, new artwork, rules clarifications, color plates by Dejan Mandic, and errata.

ZWEIHÄNDER GRIM & PERILOUS RPG is a fantasy tabletop role-playing game, one where adventurers will:


Live in a gritty, “realistic” fantasy world
Make morally grey decisions & enact vicious reprisals
Uncover insidious plots & political intrigue
Take part in heart-pumping chase scenes
Venture into the wilderness & survive its perils
Desperately fight in clandestine & open field combat
Defend themselves from injuries, madness & mutations
Encounter sanity-blasting creatures & their minions


Using the Powered By ZWEIHÄNDER d100 game engine, you will create grim characters, write perilous adventures, and build your own low fantasy & dark fantasy campaigns. These rules are a perfect fit for Renaissance and medieval-styled adventures, too. You can also use this book to create your own homebrewed worlds, whether inspired by the works of Andrzej Sapkowski’s The Witcher, George R.R. Martin’s Game of Thrones, Glen Cook’s Black Company, Myke Cole’s The Armored Saint, Robert E. Howard’s Solomon Kane, Scott Lynch’s Gentlemen Bastard series, or other “grimdark”-inspired media.

This all-in-one game includes most of what you need to play: a character creation guide, game mastery rules, and a bestiary brimming with creatures both fair & foul. All that’s left are a few friends, pencils, and a handful of dice.

ZWEIHÄNDER GRIM & PERILOUS RPG AWAITS, AND THE FATE OF YOUR GRIM & PERILOUS TALE HANGS IN THE BALANCE!

boardgame.name: Voyage Interplanetaire
boardgame.description:
A space journey that travels to planets in our solar system and returns to earth.

This french space game is a simple roll and move of pieces around a board. One dice is used initially until space 13 is reached, thereafter two dice are used.

The planets have features that either help or hinder the players. Neptune the ice planet causes players to miss a turn and Mars has friendly robots that gives players a token. Venus has lush vegetation, while Mercury is way too hot.

Players win the game by being first to return to earth by exact throw of the dice. Upon being first they receive further tokens from the other players.

The game graphics of robots and the planets is similar in style to the Buck Rogers board games of the 1930s. A German board game called Das Raketenflugzeug has an almost identical playing board and similar graphics

No publisher is evident on the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jeu De L'espace
boardgame.description:
This late 1950s French board game is unique in promoting business around the Rouen city in France.

The object of the game is for players to travel to planets by business named rockets. Players then transfer to flying saucers visiting major celestial stars and finally being first to arrive at Messier 31 (better known as the Andromeda galaxy).

A simple roll and move game where the pieces are constructed by a small rectangular card and a pin. Players push the pin into the board as they move along the space paths. They roll the dice 3 times during each players move. Some features on the board help players such as the Sputnik, while others apply a penalty such as the Space Monster.

The first to reach Messier 31 also have to answer 3 questions (2 related to the local businesses and one space question.

The game was handed out by the advertised businesses to customers.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once, the Orion Arm was humanity's plaything, the Earth Alliance expanding by leaps across interstellar space. But as happens with all our species creates, it was destroyed through greed and lust for power and spite.

A thousand years on, space is still dark, but light sometimes flickers for a while in a little corner here or there. The dream of the Alliance dies hard, and over and over one world or another has tried to recreate a fraction of its glory, only to fail.

Enter the Three Clusters, where it’s happening again. Whether or not they succeed this time depends on you.

The Three Clusters Campaign is a "classic-style" Hard Space Opera game setting, using the PWYW Cepheus Engine rules. for which Wallwichen is the first world book. Players take on the character of merchants, mercenaries, explorers, or many others in a universe where every world is hand-crafted by a veteran game setting designer.

boardgame.name: Resilience
boardgame.description:
Resilience: Facing crisis from the Big Chair deals with the resilience of a nation facing a succession of events trying to hit the nation’s key indicators of vulnerability, mainly its social cohesion and stability of its governance. The game takes the point of view of the Head of Government.

Resilience plays solo or in cooperation (usually 2-3 players) within a chosen scenario. The game acts as the adversary. Your goal is to be resilient enough to survive the scenario and achieve the expected results while putting into effect various strategies.

Resilience is a serious game played in professional and academic contexts (crisis management) but may be used for casual play!

Use a combination of 9 Roles with specific abilities (politics, homeland, foreign affairs...) and 22 Strategies or public policies (Diplomacy, Control of Government's communication, Revised Patriot Act, Cohesion of Intelligence Services...) to fight back and prevent Events and reach victory conditions stated by the scenario (such as Successive Strikes on Homeland, Government Reboot, Social movement is spreading...).

The game has been play tested with various groups of hard-core gamers and non-gamers (mostly defense-security professionals, college students).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Allwords
boardgame.description:
A rummy-type word card game. The deck has 2 cards for each consonant, 4 cards for each vowel, and 2 wild cards.

Players have a 7-card hand, and on their turn they draw to top of the draw or discard pile and discard a card. The object is to make one or more words from their hand. The game ends when a player reveals a 7-letter word in their hand. The players are ranked according the the length of the longest word in their hand, with ties broken by the length of their second word, etc. Players who cannot use all their letters to make words bust and lose the hand.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Alpha-Beta
boardgame.description:
"The Cross-Word Building Card Game". This is an Australian entry among the crossword-based card games which were very popular in the 1930s. The game is for 2 or more, with two decks being used if 5 or more play.

Ten cards are dealt to each player. During their turn, a player may do one of the following:

Lay down a complete word from their hand.
Add letters to an existing word to make another word, either in-line or crossing it as in a crossword puzzle. Adding "S" to make plurals is not allowed.
Change an existing word into a different word by removing one or more letters and adding one or more letters from the hand. Cards not removed must remain in the same order.
Discard a card and draw a card from the top of the deck or discard pile.


When one player empties their hand, each other player scores the sum of the values of the cards still in hand. Consonants are 2 points each, vowels are A 25, E 20, I 15, O 10, U 5. When one player's total reaches 100 or more, the player with the lowest score wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Cleadonia: A High Fantasy Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the center of the land known as Cleadonia is a large dark forest that has thrived since ancient time. It has held its secrets since the dawn of the world, refusing to become the domain of any kingdom. It is from these kingdoms that many adventurers travel from seeking their fortune, glory, and renown while overcoming the many dangers under the forest’s leafy canopy. Be it giants, dragons, or mortals, can you overcome the dangers of the Nimdor Forest and become one of the daring during this age of heroes?

Cleadonia is a role playing game were players take on the roles of adventurers who explore the hidden and dangerous corners of the world. The game takes place in a high fantasy world wherein lives many fantastic races, many of who are not your usual fantasy fair. In fact you will not find any playable Elves, Dwarves, Humans, Gnomes, Goblins, Halflings, or Orcs in this game. All the races in this game are anthropomorphic animals.

Cleadonia has the following:

Two six sided dice is all that is needed for all task resolution.
Magic: No need to track Mana Points or memorize spells daily. Instead the system offers a unique approach, every time a character casts a spell they make a save against fatigue.
No rolling for damage to slow down combat.
Perform combat manuevers based upon your character's choosen weapon and martial skills.
Armor: Armor in Cleadonia is more than just a stat, its reactive. As it protects you from damage, it absorbs damage and wears out. As it wears out it will need to either be replaced or repaired.
Classless based system. Instead of picking a class like in other rpgs, you build the character you want from skills and talents.
No Levels. Instead of gaining experience points and waiting to improve by going up in levels, you can spend the experience points as soon as you get them to improve your characters abilities.
Herbal Alchemy. Using your Botany and Alchemy skills to create an herbal remedy with near magical properties.
